Hey!

I am PLASMOMETER, an artist from Siberia, who recently moved here from Twitter.
I love warhammer 40k and sci-fi In general, my artworks connect technological and spiritual, and I lean heavily towards abstract art. I also love to experiment with design and printmaking.

Help me find my audience

I wonder if the opt-out option works when other people reblog your posts. Tumblr’s biggest issue is the way they give other blogs “ownership” of your content after they repost it, and I wonder if that extends to scraping content created by opted-out users from non-opted-out reblogs.

I don't know if this will be honored in the Automattic deal but it may be worth checking out. The option is located at tumblr.com/settings/[blogtitle]
It is disabled by default. Turning it on supposedly enables the prevention of sharing data with "partners...that train AI models."

Every time I accidently swipe to the Discover tab I'm instantly reminded why algorithms are universally terrible even when not driven by ad revenue. All the anger and anxiety that drove me off twitter just waiting one tab away, I wish I could disable it completely.

Heads up if you use a PC with Windows 11: recent updates have put "Copilot" on your computer! This is Microsoft's new AI and it is integral to your OS; you CANNOT delete it!

BUT! You can -disable- it. And since it spies on you, odds are you'll want to it! 

They don't make it easy, though.

Today is the day. Nightshade v1.0 is ready. Performance tuning is done, UI fixes are done. 

You can download Nightshade v1.0 from nightshade.cs.uchicago.edu 

Please read the what-is page and also the User's Guide on how to run Nightshade. It is a bit more involved than Glaze

Theft aside for a sec, AI art bores me in the sense that it lacks the feral 1 AM goblin brain energy that compelled an artist to meticulously render their favorite thing to draw. It has nothing to say, it's not excited to be here, it didn't make a series of deliberate choices.

Friends! Here's how to remove ai from your google searches using the example; fantasy horse 

Fantasy horse, before:2023 
Brings up everything posted ONLY before the year 2023 

Fantasy horse, -ai -prompt -stock -openai 
Gets rid of MOST generative images and includes current/recent images

Hello #PortfolioDay ✨
I’m Riikka, a freelance fantasy artist with a passion for characters and B&W sketches. So far I've been doing work for private clients and indie authors, but I'm open to opportunities.
Portfolio day is always a lil awkward because I feel like I’ve been sharing the same 4 images for the past 4 years. Hoping to change that this year.
Sometimes I am super lucky and get commissioned to paint fan art of things I love ;_; this was one! To match the client's Mermay story, Ed and Stede
Sketch > Final 🎨✨

Hi all! Nightshade tests continue. We would also like to ask for artists' help on a new research study that evaluates the ability of artists and software tools to reliably separate generative AI images and art by human artists. Please help us on a survey:

This is a lie, and it's always been a lie. Something like ChatGPT needs a TON of text in the language you're targeting to train the model. You get it by licensing it, or you by paying people to write it for you, or by stealing it.  What they're saying is it's impossible to create CHEAPLY.

"Luddism was a working-class movement opposed to the political consequences of industrial capitalism. The Luddites wanted technology to be deployed in ways that made work more humane and gave workers more autonomy. The bosses, on the other hand, wanted to drive down costs and increase productivity."

Mm so they want journalism without journalists, images without artists, books without writers, and performances with no actors. I dunno seems like they just hate everyone and this whole thing is incompatible with humanity and should be dismantled stem to stern I dunno I dunno

I'm pretty satisfied with all of my decisions and think I did a good job of finding the best outcome. Particularly for Karlach - on a hunch I took a gamble and it paid off, I'm so glad that she gets to be happy, she deserves it so much. 🥺

Already thinking about my next play though, but I'll probably run one of the origins - I'm a little over-attached to Solvi and feeling pretty bummed that her story is over, not ready for a new tav just yet.

Solvi, my dwarf tempest cleric. I finally finished my BG3 play through yesterday and I'm still recovering from it - such a good game!!

Astarion/Lae'zel is the funniest ship to me this dumb twink seduces the most vicious woman for his protection and ends up battered and bruised anyway. Then torments her by calling her cutesy pet names and getting her to cuddle. Then they run off and do murder together and couldn't be more in love.

Lamassu are a human faced, winged bull creature/deity found in Mesopotamian cultures. Mesopotamia being a historical region where the Sumerians, Akkadians, Assyrians and Babylonians lived over different eras. They're protectors who embody strength, intelligence, and freedom✨

Hello Bluesky! Figured it was time to connect to folks here before the birdsite is fully rendered down into sludge and I lose track of y'all. I quit twitter for Mastodon last year, so it's nice to see some of you again!

I'll probably just post some old art for a bit while I figure things out here.
